glsa.title: libzip: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libzip, the worst of which might allow execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: libzip is a library for manipulating zip archives.

description.p: Two vulnerabilities have been found in the "_zip_readcdir()" function in zip_open.c of libzip:

ul.li: An incorrect loop construct, which could cause a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2012-1162).
An integer overflow, which may not restrict operations within the memory buffer (CVE-2012-1163).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted ZIP file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition, or information leaks.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
